definitions.definition: A stone milepost (or by extension in other materials), one of a series of numbered markers placed along a road at regular intervals, typically at the side of the road or in a median.
An important event in a person's life or career , in the history of a nation , in the life of some project , etc.

main_definition: A stone milepost (or by extension in other materials), one of a series of numbered markers placed along a road at regular intervals, typically at the side of the road or in a median.
secondary_definitions: ( idiomatic ) An important event in a person's life or career , in the history of a nation , in the life of some project , etc.
